nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
# Manage Webflow form submissions in Discord 
## Full guide with video
[Full guide with video here]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

This workflow dynamically creates Discord channels for your Webflow forms then sends form submissions to those channels. The Webflow form name is used to make the channel name.

## Getting started
1. Create Webflow credential using API V1 Token
2. Create Discord credentials using Bot API by making an application [Your applications in Discord]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} for a detailed list of scopes for your application please see the video guide above.
3. Connect your credentials to the relevant nodes on the canvas.
4. Activate the workflow and submit a form on your Webflow site

That's it! You do not need to add any custom code to your Webflow forms or site.

The name of your forms in the form settings section of the Designer in Webflow will be used to create the Discord channels. This workflow will automatically do this for you.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### Format the message 
Discord accepts Markdown

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### False branch 
We create a new Discord channel using the form name in Webflow. Channel names must be converted to lowercase and words separated with dash.

When the new channel is created we send a message in the #general channel with a direct link to the new channel.

Finally we send the Webflow form submission as a message in the new channel.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
### Combining data to move forward 
This code will check if a channel with the form name exists in Discord. 

We also create an object to pass forward to the next node.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Send Discord message from Webflow form submission

## Overview
Automated workflow: Send Discord message from Webflow form submission. This workflow integrates 7 different services: stickyNote, code, set, discord, stopAndError. It contains 17 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 17
- **Node Types**: 7
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Does the channel exist?**: if
- **Transform data to send message**: set
- **Webflow Form Submission Trigger**: webflowTrigger
- **Compose Slack message**: code
- **List Discord Channels**: discord
- **Filter existing Discord channel**: code
- **Create Discord channel with form name**: discord
- **Notify #general channel of newly created channel1**: discord
- **Send form submission to Discord channel**: discord
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- ... and 7 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
